page.title: 04A Conservation Issue
page.content: Platinum is sometimes found in serpentine and as early as l925 it was looked for in the chromite quarries.In February this year a planning application was lodged by Exxon Minerals Company to dig explor- ation trenches at 3 sites in the area. Platinum was the goal. Each trench was to be l00 metres long with a 70 metre cross trench.This area of serpentine heathland supports a rich breeding bird and botanical community including 6% of the British population of whimbrel l% of British Arctic skuas, some golden plover, arctic terns and less rare species.Objections were raised so the application was refused. A random survey of 40 people in the area showed an overwhelming majority in favour of Exxon's proposals (under strict control) to provide jobs.They thought local consultation was needed.
